results.title: Lipid-lowering therapy does not affect the postprandial drop in high density lipoprotein-cholesterol (HDL-c) plasma levels in obese men with metabolic syndrome: a randomized double blind crossover trial.
results.text_hl: METHODS: Prospective, randomized, double blind, crossover trial comparing @CHEMICAL_Simvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 80 mg with @<m>CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe_Simvastatin_Drug_Combination</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069499 @@@simvastatin/ezetimibe@@@ 10 mg/10 mg @DISEASE_Neoplasms_Second_Primary @DISEASE_MESH:D016609 @@@treatment@@@ for 6 weeks on postprandial HDL-c metabolism in 15, nonsmoking, male, @<m>DISEASE_Obesity_Metabolically_Benign</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000067329 @@@obese metabolic syndrome@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (Adult @DISEASE_Neoplasms_Second_Primary @DISEASE_MESH:D016609 @@@Treatment@@@ Panel @DISEASE_Rufous_oculocutaneous_albinism @DISEASE_MESH:C537189 @@@III@@@, ATPIII).

citations.NLM: Hajer GR, Dallinga-Thie GM, van Vark-van der Zee LC, Olijhoek JK, Visseren FL. Lipid-lowering therapy does not affect the postprandial drop in high density lipoprotein-cholesterol (HDL-c) plasma levels in obese men with metabolic syndrome: a randomized double blind crossover trial. Clin Endocrinol (Oxf). 2008 Dec;69(6):870-7. PMID: 18394022
